example.eg: He touched her shoulder.
example.egtrans: 他拍了拍她的肩膀。

example.eg: She touched the blouse to feel its fabric.
example.egtrans: 她摸了摸衬衫，以感受其质地。

example.eg: She was touched by the woman's life story.
example.egtrans: 她被那女子的生平感动了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 感动, 触动, 影响

example.eg: His touch comforted her.
example.egtrans: 他的抚摸使她好受了些。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 接触, 触摸, 抚摸

example.eg: The designer from Milan added an Italian touch to the room.
example.egtrans: 这位来自米兰的设计师为房间增添了一些意大利风格。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 风格, 格调, 特色

example.eg: He has a good touch with the football.
example.egtrans: 他踢足球的脚法很灵巧。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 能力, 手法, 手法

example.eg: He has no sense of touch in his fingers.
example.egtrans: 他的手指没有触觉。

example.eg: Many people like the touch of silk.
example.egtrans: 许多人都喜欢丝绸的触感。

example.eg: I need to get in touch with him.  Let me phone him now.
example.egtrans: 我需要联系他，我现在就打电话给他。

example.eg: The leader has lost touch with popular will.
example.egtrans: 领导人已经失去了对民意的警觉。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 感觉, 意识, 警觉

example.eg: She has a nice touch with the customers that they appreciate.
The penman put a bold touch on every serif.
example.egtrans: 那个书法家的每个衬线笔触都很大胆。

example.eg: They have added some nice touches to this kitchen.  Look at those details.
That was a touch for five thousand dollars!  How rich does he think I am?

trans_examp.trans_cn: 借钱, 要钱, 讨钱

example.eg: John is staying home from work today because he has a touch of fever.
example.egtrans: 由于约翰今天有一点发烧，所以他歇业在家。

example.eg: The two tables touched.
example.egtrans: 两张桌子相互接触。

example.eg: The table touches the wall.
Move the sofa back so it touches the wall.
She can't touch you for efficiency.  You are so reliable.
I asked him to talk to me about his problems, but wasn't able to touch him.
Don't you touch her or I will kill you!
The child hadn't touched his food.
This article doesn't touch the problems in Sudan.
Don't worry.  This matter doesn't touch you.
He touched me for twenty pounds yesterday.
The line touches the circle at point "A".
The flowers have been touched by the frost.
example.egtrans: 霜冻使那些花轻度受损。

example.eg: The plane had to touch down in Dallas due to severe weather.
The new virus touched off an epidemic.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 引爆，使爆炸, 触发，引发

example.eg: In the course of the interview we touched upon the delicate matter of his conviction for assault.
She found her boyfriend at the bar touching up another girl.
I touched up my English paper right before turning it in.
Her lecture did not touch upon the details of accounting.
Are you two still in touch?
example.egtrans: 你们两人还在联系吗？

example.eg: We'll be in touch soon.
example.egtrans: 我们很快会联系的。

example.eg: Have you been in touch with her recently?
Are you still in touch with your friends from high school?

trans_examp.trans_cn: 与…一直保持联系, 与…一直保持联络

example.eg: I'm putting the finishing touches to the icing on the wedding cake.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 收尾工作, 最后修整, 最后加工

example.eg: The room was decorated beautifully, and the fresh flowers on each table were the finishing touch.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 最后的修饰, 最后润色

example.eg: Don't hesitate to get in touch if you have any questions.
example.egtrans: 如有任何问题，请随时与我联系。

example.eg: I would like to get in touch with my old friends from college.
example.egtrans: 我想和我大学的老朋友们取得联系。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 和…联系, 和…取得联系

dsense.name: hit a nerve, touch a nerve, strike a nerve, hit a raw nerve, touch a raw nerve, strike a raw nerve

example.eg: Cousin Andrea kept in touch by sending packages from South America.
example.egtrans: 安德莉亚表妹通过从南非邮寄包裹来保持联系。

example.eg: Promise you'll keep in touch with us while you're away.
example.egtrans: 保证你离开以后也会与我们保持联系。

dsense.name: knock on wood (US), touch wood (UK)
dsense.guideword: (said in order to avoid bad luck)

example.eg: Everything's going well so far—touch wood!

trans_examp.trans_cn: 老天保佑, 祈求好运

example.eg: Colin and I were great friends, but we lost touch after we left university.
example.egtrans: 我和科林曾是很好的朋友，但是我们在大学毕业后就失去了联系。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 失去联系, 失去联络

dsense.name: lose touch with [sb]
dsense.guideword: informal (not keep in contact with [sb]) (非正式用语)

example.eg: I lost touch with so many of my classmates, there was no point in going to the class reunion.

dsense.name: lose touch
dsense.guideword: figurative, informal (not keep up to date)

example.eg: I used to be well informed about French politics, but I have lost touch since I moved out here.
example.egtrans: 我过去很了解法国政治，但是自从离开那里后，我的消息就落后了。

dsense.name: lose touch with [sth]
dsense.guideword: figurative, informal (not keep up to date with [sth]) (非正式用语)

example.eg: Critics have accused the leader of losing touch with the mood of the public.

dsense.name: out-of-touch
dsense.guideword: figurative, informal (unfamiliar with what is current)

example.eg: It is frustrating having to deal with an out-of-touch boss.

dsense.name: be out of touch
dsense.guideword: figurative, informal (not be up to date)

example.eg: Many members of the team have ended up resigning because their manager is so out of touch.

dsense.name: be out of touch with [sth]
dsense.guideword: figurative, informal (not be up to date with)

example.eg: These systems are completely out of touch with modern business practices.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 跟不上…的发展, 跟不上...的步伐

example.eg: These problems have arisen because the government is made up of wealthy politicians who are completely out of touch with how ordinary people live.
My brother moved away ten years ago; we've been out of touch since then.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 没有联系的, 失去联系的

example.eg: Unfortunately I'm out of touch with Rita, so I can't give her the news.

dsense.name: out of touch with the real world

example.eg: Politicians who think they can cut public services and retain popularity are obviously out of touch with the real world.

dsense.name: put [sb] in touch, put [sb] and [sb] in touch

example.eg: You've never met Jeff before, but I can put you in touch.
You've reached the wrong department, but I can put you in touch with someone who can help you.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 安排...与...联系, 给...提供...的联系方式

example.eg: She kicked the ball and put it in touch.

dsense.name: soft touch
dsense.guideword: informal, figurative ([sb] who is easy to persuade)

example.eg: Ask Dad to give you the money. He's a soft touch - he's bound to say yes.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 容易上当的人, 耳根子软的人

example.eg: Bye.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 保持联系, 保持联络

example.eg: I still stay in touch with my best friend from childhood.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 保持联系, 保持联络

example.eg: The surgeons said it was touch and go as they tried to repair his ruptured spleen.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 一触即发的危险，千钧一发的境地

example.eg: We'll touch base when you've finished the first task.
Touch base with me in a few weeks so I can see how the project's coming along.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 接触, 联系, 联络

example.eg: The pilot's touchdown was surprisingly smooth in spite of the strong winds.
Gregory scored his first touchdown against the Tigers today!

dsense.name: touch football, also UK: American touch football

example.eg: Touch football is a version of rugby without tackling.
After  a quick touch-up to her lipstick, Jennifer was ready to go.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 微调, 润色, 稍微修饰

dsense.name: touch your heart
dsense.guideword: informal, figurative (move you emotionally) (非正式用语，比喻)

example.eg: She touched my heart with her beautiful poem.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 触及你的心灵，让你感动, 打动人心

example.eg: The fitness instructor told everyone to touch their toes.
